values.value:
The customer’s bank account requires manual validation as the ANZ data check could not match it with the customer’s registered bank account name.
The following actions are required:
Check the customer’s case history to see if a recent bank statement is on file (possibly as part of identity validation, dated within the last 12 months). If there is, check the account number and name on the statement match the bank account number and bank account name on the customer record. If they match, release the deposit.
If there is no statement on file, check the ANZ Provided Name against the customer’s registered bank account name to see if there is a high degree of confidence that it is a match. Consult Guidance for Managing AML. If you are satisfied that the account is a match, have your decision peer-reviewed before releasing the deposit.
If the name cannot be matched with confidence, contact the customer IMMEDIATELY via case email and request a recent bank statement (of the registered account). When received, check the account number and name on the statement match the bank account number and bank account name on the customer record. If they match, release the deposit.
Bank account requires manual validation before releasing deposit
